Special Work of the Local Government Board for the Week ended January 4th 1918.
G.T.3202
1. Conferences have been held and progress has been made with the preparation of the Bill to extend and amend the system of registration under the National Registration Act, 1915.
2. Consideration has been given to a draft Defence of the Realm Regulation empowering the Admiralty, Army Council, and Ministry of Munitions to take over the control and maintenance of highways where necessary in connection with war purposes, and requiring local authorities to contribute the normal cost of maintenance of the road towards the expenditure of the Departments on their upkeep.
3. A conference has been held with the War Office, the Board of Agriculture, the Ministry of Munitions, and the Ministry of Food on the subject of extended measures for the general conservation and utilisation of waste products.
4. The Board have drawn the attention of the local authorities of various towns containing a number of uninterned enemy aliens to the fact that uninterned enemy aliens enrolled as National Service Volunteers can be called upon to undertake work of national importance, and have suggested their employment by the local authorities, subject to conditions prescribed by the Minister for National Service, in connection with essential sanitary services, for which there is a shortage of labour.
